segments.text: Did you hear what happened to Mike in Accounts ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . What ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: He got arrested on Friday night and spent the night in jail .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . Really , what happened ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , it was all a big mistake , actually . He got home on Friday night really late , and apparently he'd been out drinking with some clients , so he was really drunk .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Was he out with the guys from the bank ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I think so .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , yeah , they always get really drunk .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , anyway , he'd somehow lost his wallet and his house keys , so he couldn't get in . He lives alone , you know .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , really . I thought he lived with his wife .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , she left him last year .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , really ? Do you know why ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hang on , let me finish telling you what happened . Where was I ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He lost his wallet and keys .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh yes , well , he tried to climb in through the bathroom window , but apparently he slipped and broke the glass with his foot . The neighbors heard him and thought a robbery was in progress , so they called the police .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , no .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . So when the cops arrived , they didn't believe his story
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: So then what happened ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , when he sobered up , he called someone from work to come and bail him out .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , that's a bit of a tricky situation .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I know .
segments.speaker: S1
